name: Floresta de Anhangá
description:
Casual Game, made for a Brazilian contest. I haven't done the translation but the game is quite simple. Just run on the forest trying to save as many animals as possible, you have until the dawn to lose the game, it is made to be unbeatable, as this game represents a tragedy on the Amazon Rainforest.

Attributions:

Marcelo Silva Nascimento Mancini: Game Programming

Pedro Silva Nascimento Mancini: The game logo and some sprites for the game

Defeat Music -> Janne Hanhisuanto for Radakan

Startup Music -> Shalpin for Ice Wastes - https://opengameart.org/content/icy-wastes

Trees -> Jetrel, Zabin, Hyptosis e Surte - https://opengameart.org/content/lots-of-trees-and-plants-from-oga-db32-tilesets-...

Birds -> Bluecarrot16

Other assets are under Public Domain

How to Play:

W - Up

A - Left

S - Down

D - Right

Enter: Interaction button

Use the arrow keys to move the camera

Interact with an animal, bring it close to the cave and interact again. The game is pretty short and some messages  of what Ananhgá is thinking appear based on how many animals he saved.
